titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Joseph Mullendore Music Manuscripts LSC.2243
titlestmt.author: Processed by Lauren Jung with assistance from Julie Graham, 2012. Finding aid prepared by Kelly Besser, 2021.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2021 January 6.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-06 14:54:32 -0800.

did.abstract: Collection consists of assorted music manuscripts related to the career of music composer Joseph Mullendore.
did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact UCLA Library Special Collections for paging information.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact UCLA Library Special Collections for paging information.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UC Regents. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Joseph Mullendore music manuscripts (Collection Number 2243). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Joseph Milton Mullendore Jr. was born in Philadelphia, PA on October 21, 1914. He was educated at Philadelphia Conservatory. He began his career in film and television as an arranger, often scoring the compositions of his colleague Herschel Burke Gilbert (and others). In the early 1950s, he began scoring and arranging for motion pictures such as The Jackie Robinson Story (1950), New York Confidential (1955), While the City Sleeps (1956), and The Shaggy Dog (1959). He also composed and conducted music scores for a number of popular television programs such as Burke's Law, Honey West, Lost In Space, The Rifleman, Twilight Zone, and Zane Grey Theatre, among others. He was nominated for an Emmy award in the 1962-1963 for his work on The Dick Powell Theater. Joe Mullendore died on June 19, 1990 in Pasadena, CA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of assorted music manuscripts related to the career of music composer Joseph Mullendore and a small amount of published sheet music written by others. Included are materials representing the television programs The Dick Powell Show and Zane Grey Theater, a small amount of printed sheet music featuring Sid Robin, and scores by Mullendore and others.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically by folder titles.

did.unittitle: Bolero - onion skin score and parts

odd.head: General note
odd.p: With published material about Hammond organs.

odd.p: With Blues in 3, Tomorrow the Man, The Three Bears and Argentina, among others.

odd.p: Appears to be from the Mickey Mouse Club.
